intro: Eschweilera longipes, commonly known as the longipes evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lecanoraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered together. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Eschweilera longipes is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
